title: Duty-Free Shops in Arrivals Flop
text:
The new duty-free shops in the arrivals areas of Incheon International Airport have proved a dismal flop four months after opening amid high hopes that they would attract Koreans returning home from overseas trips.

The shops in arrivals had the support of President Moon Jae-in, who said in August last year that Koreans traveling abroad have to suffer too much hassle lugging their duty-free purchases on board.

But according to the Korea Customs Service last week, the shops generated just W18.8 billion in revenues from May 31, the day of their opening, until the end of September, a mere half of what was expected (US$1=W1,186).

Airport operators had expected W106.2 billion in annual revenues, so sales in the four-month period would have had to total W35.4 billion to meet that target.

The best monthly sales were achieved in June with W5.4 billion amid a massive publicity campaign, but they soon dropped back to W4.2 billion in July, edged up to W4.8 billion during peak vacation season in August and then plunged to W4.3 billion in September.
